Reviews.Title: “can't fault this hotel.”
Reviews.Author: bcp1
Reviews.Content: Genuinely the best hotel I've stayed in. Fantastic location in the beautiful Hackescher Markt (loads of shops, boutiques, restaurants and cafes) as well as being really close to the S Bahn station and bus stops. 5-10 minute walk to museum island, 20-30 minute walk to the Brandenburg gate. The rooms are spacious and stylish, as well as extremely clean (the maid came every day whilst we were there.) The cocktail bar is also worth a visit - with happy hour between 5 and 7pm (cocktails are around 5 euro at this time) the cocktails are delicious!! The hotel staff are really helpful and friendly also. For saying we paid 95 euro a night for 2, I really can't recommend this hotel enough!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Could hardly have been better if we'd designed it ourselves”
Reviews.Author: Roskolnikov
Reviews.Content: Best thing about this hotel: location, in the midst of the Mitte district, one block from Hackescher Markt, where there was transit, food, and relative quiet. Strategically amongst attractions including Museum Island, the Pope's Revenge tower, Unter den Liden, and the Nickolaikirche neighborhood. Easy walking or transit distance from the Brandenburg Gate and Checkpoint Charlie. Highly practical kitchen allowed us to have many meals in with foods bought within a few blocks of the hotel. Nice view of the tower. Only problems were the glacially slow wifi (free in the lobby only) and the shower, which seemed to pour more water out of the shower (which had no door, in keeping with many European hotels) than remained inside of it. It took all of our towels every day to sop up the spillage. All in all, though, an excellent hotel and an extraordinarily good value.

Reviews.Title: “Modern comfort”
Reviews.Author: MagnusG
Reviews.Content: Nice one bedroom suite. Very clean and modern. Washer and dryer in the bathroom. Small but nice kitchenett with dishwasher. Two flattscreen tvs but not free wireless. Close to S bahn and Hackescher Markt. Maybe not very romantic but practical.

Reviews.Title: “Business as usual”
Reviews.Author: afreitag
Reviews.Content: Almost nothing wrong with this place. Spacious rooms, good location. Only complaint: charging guests for a very slow wireless connection feels totally 1998.

Reviews.Title: “Solo first-timer”
Reviews.Author: sk8momy
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to Europe, and my first solo overseas trip. I am in the 55+ category. I arrived at the hotel after a 16-plus hour journey. I had purchased the business package prior to my arrival. It was morning when I arrived at the hotel, and I was starved. I was able to use one of my breakfast vouchers for my arrival day. Breakfast quickly became the high point of my day. Stephanie, one of the wait staff was superlative! She was always smiling, and by the end of my stay, she had my eggs on the table by the time I made my first pass through the buffet. The staff even offered to put together a bag breakfast for an impossibly early airport departure. Front desk staff was always helpful and very attentive. They helped with my sightseeing plans, giving me maps, making suggestions(which were spot on), and offering tips on the best forms of transportation to certain attractions. When I was able to secure an appointment for the Reichstag Builing, they were more than happy to print off my confirmation letter. I loved the fact that public transportation was a half-block away, and yet the room was soundproof, and I slept like I was in the countryside. There was a supermarket within walking distance for times when I wanted a little snack .English TV channels were adequate. I was concerned that the three hours daily internet access included in the business plan would not be enough, but I did what I needed to do, Skyped family, and still had time left over. I did use the hot tub. After a long day of walking, and climbing stairs, it was like heaven. My use of a bathing suit instantly branded me as a North American, but it turned out that I wasn't the only one. As far as the other services available, I returned to my room after the massage hours were over. I was too tired to use the exercise equipment. If/when i have the opportunity to return to Berlin, there is no other place that I would even consider staying at. For anyone planning a trip, I do suggest adding the Business Plan. Having the wireless internet in the room was well worth it, especially when you are deaing with significant time differences at home. While you can cook your own breakfast, why bother when the choices are so vast and varied.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: mandy39
Reviews.Content: This was our first visit to Berlin and found that the Adina Apartment Hotel was in a fantastic location. Within walking distance to the TV tower, Museum Island and the Brandenburg Gate. There were also plenty of bars and restaurants within walking distance. The staff were very friendly and helpful and even printed off the letter we needed to get into one of the attractions. The rooms themselves were great. We had a one bedroom apartment and loved the sitting area and kitchenette. The bathroom was huge with a great powerful shower and the washing machine and tumble dryer came in handy. The only thing that would have made it even better would have been a shower cap! I would not hesitate to recommend this hotel to friends and family and would be more than happy to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Ideal for city break to berlin”
Reviews.Author: joblob
Reviews.Content: Located within easy distance from all the main sites, can walk to most but trains easily accesible. Recommend cocktail happy hour in hotel. Apartments offer kitchen facilities so not always buying food out and as we travelled with friends offerred a communal area to chill out in the room.

Reviews.Title: “great location, poor internet access and no concierge service”
Reviews.Author: travelhoundIndia
Reviews.Content: The hotel location is one of the best in a lively part of Berlin. It has the advantage of being very close (less than 50 meters from the S-Bahn) and in an area blessed with a rich history, culture, authentic restaurants and affordable retail fashions. The Hotel itself does all the basic things well except that there is no concierge service (the front desk staff and a bartender named Andrew have occasionally provided me with concierge service during my week long stay but only if they were not otherwise occupied with their real jobs. It is hard to consider this hotel as a four star hotel as it has been rated without a proper concierge service. The service that I find the most disappointing, however, is the poor internet access. I was obligated to use the hotel internet in either their lobby or their bar in order to avoid additional charges which add approximately $15 to the daily room charge. I must admit that I am spoiled by the ubiquitous and inexpensive nature of internet in Canada. Most hotels provide internet service at no additional charge and few would expect their guests to use only the lobby or bar in order to receive free internet. It is unfortunate that this otherwise pleasant hotel do not provide a proper concierge service or provide more accessible or more affordable internet given that it is now 2012 and both services make a difference, at least to this traveller.

Reviews.Title: “3rd stay at this hotel”
Reviews.Author: NigelDJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Once again a very good stay, friendly and efficient staff, good value for money and an excellent breakfast offering. I would only say that one should check to air conditioning/ventilation system on first entering the bedroom assigned as in my case I could not get the room temperature low enough for my personal comfort.

Reviews.Title: “Nice stay and great location”
Reviews.Author: pinturicchio1
Reviews.Content: We had a very good stay at Adina's. The rooms are furnished in modern style, fully equipped and the locations is very close to the museum island; we hardly had to use public transport during our stay. Depsite the large number of room and visitors, it was relatively quiet in the rooms; the only downside was the ventilation system that could not be swithced off at night. Free wifi connection if the lobby; you need to get a login and passowrd from the reception and login as "visitor", not as "guest". Very reasonable prices for room service.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it so much that I've booked the return stay!”
Reviews.Author: eakcats
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Adina Checkpoint Charkie 2 years. While we loved everything about the hotel concept, we were intrigued at the time to learn that a site near Hackescher Markt was in the works. When I returned to Berlin in December, 2011, we stayed at the Adina Hackescher Markt. As a result, I am bringing a group to stay later this week. The location is perfect. Most East Berlin tourist attractions are within walking distance. Because the hotel is a few steps from a S Bahn station, West Berlin tourist locations are easy to reach. Several walking tours start steps away from the hotel. The hotel is nearly perfect. The apartments have a spacious bathroom with washer and dryer, a compact but extremely well equipped kitchen, a living room space and bedroom. There is ample closet space. While the many restaurants in the area are exciting, it was also fun to have the options of the onsite restaurant, room service, and the facilities to cook! As noted by other reviewers, the fee based wifi was disappointing. Free wifi is available in the lobby via a coupon per device. When we ran into problems printing a confirmation for the Reichstag, the staff immediately assisted by letting us use the front desk printer. The hotel also provides a broader range of English language TV channels than many European hotels. In addition to the convenient transportation links, there is also a taxi rank near the hotel. I honestly don't think you can go wrong with any of the Adina locations in Berlin but the Hackescher Markt location is my favorite. Strongly recommended. Will post another review after my next stay later this week with some hyper critical relatives!

Reviews.Title: “Great stay”
Reviews.Author: Millevoyages
Reviews.Content: On a business trip, the ideal place to relax, work, prepare a coffee or tea and visit some places. The only downside during my stay was a late night party outside of the building on the other side of the small garden (around 2 AM). The hotel excused for that in advance, but should have done more than that. Also, with open windows, smoke of people smoking in this garden enters into your room. Otherwise a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, friendly staff, wonderfull room”
Reviews.Author: jams69
Reviews.Content: I can highly recommend the Adina Hackescher Market. It is hard to beat the location, the service was excellent and the room/apartment defintely exceeded expectations. It is hard to beat the location of this hotel. It is located literally 2 minutes walk for the Hackescher Markt S-bahn stations and is walking distance to many of the main sights: Alexanderplatz, the museum island (Bode Pergammon, etc), Unter Den Linden and much more. It was also a short train or bus ride to to many of the other main sights and places of interest in the city. We decided to take a day trip to Potsdam and were very pleased to discover that there are 6 direct trains an hour between Hackescher Markt and Potsdam! We booked a one bedroom apartment for a 4 night stay and chose the hotel based on the location, price and reviews on TripAdvisor. The bedroon and bathroom were large by many hotel standards and the lounge/kitchen/dinner was also spactious, well equiped and very modern. Everything still looked brand new! There was even a small balcony where we could enjoy the first rays of the morning sun with a view of the TV tower at Alexander platz. The apartment was equiped with a dishwasher, washing machine and tumble dryer, as well as the expected cooker, microwave oven, fridge and kettle. This made it ideal for a longer stay and we are considering coming back for exactly that. The bedroom had twin beds, but it was no problem to push them together for a it more comfort. There was also lots of hanging and storage space. The bathroom had a full bath, which was very much appreciated after a long day walking round the Sanssouci park at Potsdam! The staff were very friendly and helpfull, without overdoing it.The only (and admitedly small) gripe we had was that there was no free internet in the rooms. This was a little surprising, but did not detract from the quality of ths stay. Our only regret was that we did not have time to try out the pool and fitness centre in the basement! I would strongly recommend this hotel for anyone visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “A really great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: Shimmyshammy
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this apartment recently and cannot praise it enough. The staff at the reception were really friendly and welcoming,especially Alexandra,who went out of her way to deliver exceptional customer service. Our room 718 was fantastic,roomy with bright decor and although we overlooked the main street,it was really quite.The location is central with the S-Bahn station located less than 5 mins away,it is really easy to get to from Berlin Schonefeld Airport. The surrounding area is lively with great places to eat. Overall I would definitely recommended it.

Reviews.Title: “Adina Comes through again”
Reviews.Author: RenniePerth
Reviews.Content: Loved Adina Hackescher Market. We were upgraded to a 2 bedroom (maybe they ran out of 1 bedrooms) and had a huge apartment with 2 bathrooms. Was really beautiful - couldnt ask for anything better...seriously. Good Location, turn left out of the hotel and under the bridge heaps of great restaurants. Supermarket close by, big department store 10 mins on foot. Berlin is big, i dont know how you choose where to stay, but for us I was really pleased with my choice.

Reviews.Title: “Good value, good location”
Reviews.Author: WhirledTravlr
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, great location, LOVED the washer and dryer in the room. Every modern comfort, good breakfast options. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: loves2spooge
Reviews.Content: Absolutely loved my stay at the Adina in Hackescher Markt! The room was huge, spotless, modern and had a very boutique feel. We stayed in a room that had a small kitchen, fridge, sink, toaster, kettle etc. The bathroom was lovely. The bed absolutely massive and very comfortable. Staff were friendly and the location was great - being a stones throw away from the S-bahn. I struggle to write something negative about my stay - but my only complaint (which really isn't a complaint at all!) is that the room was very warm, even with the air conditioning on the lower temperature! We stayed in November, when it was freezing outside... So that was really a good thing most of the time! But sometimes it got a little uncomfortable. Worth mentioning but would absolutely not put my off staying here again and recommending to friends. I will definitely go back!

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommended!”
Reviews.Author: Kjmjs
Reviews.Content: Very modern, clean and great location. I have stayed twice and would stay again when next in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay and Fab Breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hotbreak
Reviews.Content: Great apartments and fantastic service. Stay was great. Brakfasr was a delight!

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities and great location at a great price!”
Reviews.Author: tract13
Reviews.Content: Close to the Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station. The air-conditioned rooms were a great size with a studio type living room (complete with balcony_ & kitchen with a separate king sized bedroom. The breakfast was very tasty but over-priced at €19 per person, that was the only down side. There is a very handy Kamps coffee shop 10m away at a third of the price for the same meal. The staff were very helpful at all times.

Reviews.Title: “Very comfortable hotel apartment, definitely stay here again...”
Reviews.Author: lovestotravel2230
Reviews.Content: Very pleased with this choice of hotel. We stayed in a 1 bed apartment which was very spacious and comfortable. The separate bedroom provided a comfy double bed with lots of wardrobe space. The lounge area was comfy and the kitchen nicely equipped as well as table and chairs for dining. The bathroom was great and there was even a washing machine and tumble drier! It was a 15 minute walk to the Brandenburg gate and just a few minutes walk from the station so very well located. Would definitely stay here the next time we visit as as well as being clean, spacious and friendly it was very well priced, thank you very much!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Scifchic
Reviews.Content: I spent over 6 months here and I must say I have no complaints. The rooms are modern and well appointed, the facilities are great and the staff is amazing; I truly feel like part of the family here. Will definitely come here on my return trip.

Reviews.Title: “well-located and -outfitted”
Reviews.Author: ns4
Reviews.Content: New, well-appointed apartments. Location good for S-bahn and trams, lots of restaurants ,shops and market. Close to Museum Island.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel in the middle of everything-perfect for family”
Reviews.Author: northern_light0407
Reviews.Content: We stayed with our 2 kids (4 and 8) for a weekend at the beginning of december 2011 in a 2-bedroom apartment. The hotel was very easy to find and as we knew parking lots are not available in this region we parked our car in the basement (EUR 19,00 24 hrs). The apartment was nice, clean and big enough to fit the four of us. The view was excellent, facing the Alexanderplatz-side. The location is unbeatable: just a few steps either to the museum (5min. by foot), Alexanderpaltz with the Christmas Market and its shopping malls or Hackescher Markt with lots of restaurants, smaller shops and the S-Bahn as well. There are a supermarket and a drugstore just around the corner. The only bad thing I would like to mention ist that the breakfast could improve a little: the pancakes were always cold (as the warmers were all set to the lowest postion - environmental reasons???). Although we were almost alone in the restaurant the waiter asked us about coffee/tea after 20 min. Overall, I would definitely stay in this hotel for its unbeatable location, tranquility and cleanliness.

Reviews.Title: “Birthday in Berlin”
Reviews.Author: anthonioandsue
Reviews.Content: We went to Berlin for the first time on a four day mini break to celebrate my birthday .Stayed at the Adina because of its central location ,excellent reviews and we fully endorse this hotels excellent reputation . Our room was upgraded to a two bed apartment . The restaurant food is good and the breakfast is exceptional and we experienced the wonderful sparkling hot tubs and sauna . Staff are just ever so friendly, helpful and so efficient. Arrived late from the airport 11.30 pm and even at that late hour the kitchen staff were happy to serve us with food. Special mention to Patrick on reception who was very helpful. We found a very good supermarket very close by but only on the last day so ask at reception for directions.What is there not to like about the Adina ?

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: o12
Reviews.Content: Berlin was our 2nd last stop after a 6 week trip around UK & Europe so we were getting a bit weary, so looking for an apartment to relax in. We booked a 2 bedroom apartment which was just great, 2 large beds, kitchen, washer,dryer and 2 bathrooms. Excellent location just down from the SBahn and lots of restaurants and a supermarket just across the road. If you are interested doing something different while in Berlin I highly recommend a Segway tour, we had the most wonderful experience going thru all the sights of Berlin in this unique way. I am a middle aged mother and it took no time at all in learning how to ride the segway and we enjoyed the experience soo much that I went back to the apartment and booked a tour for Rome a few days later. The segway pickup spot was just down the road from the hotel under the TV Tower.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay!”
Reviews.Author: HolidayHot
Reviews.Content: Centrally located Adina whit friendly service. We had a one bedroom apartment which was spacious and comfortable. The room was facing the street and you could also see the trains but we found that inside the room it was quiet and peaceful. Bed was confortable and sitting area spacious enough if you wished to spend the night in (not enough nights). Big plus after travelling for a while was the washing machine and dryer, didn't feel like looking for laundries etc. Did not try the breakfast (pricey) or the bar. Around the corner from reception there is a nice coffeeshop/bakery which makes nice snadwiches and around the other corner there is a great bagel place which you can toast in you room for breakfast. Great break from hotel stays.

Reviews.Title: “nice large rooms”
Reviews.Author: lindyloo6
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the adina apartment hotel in Dec 2011 for my annual Christmas market hop to Berlin. Knew the area in which the hotel is situated and knew that it was good for nightlife and connection to S Bahn . Stayed in the studio appartment as it was just the 2 of us and this was more than ample The rooms were equipt with everything that you would need for a weeks stay or longer. Our room had a small balcony overlooking the front of the hotel with a chair and a liitle table on it. The bathroom contained a shower i usually insist on a bath when in Berlin due to the amount of walking we normally undertake i enjoy a good soak before getting ready to go out again but i didnt mind having just a shower, the only drawback was no shower screen or curtain so the floor got very wet and slippy. The kitchen was a bonus everything you could need also a dining table and sofa. There was an ajoining door if there was a need for families to be next door to each other. We didnt take breakfast so cannot comment on this, but the menu for the evening meals looked good and pretty reasonable in price. Would stay here again when in Berlin

Reviews.Title: “Stay Here”
Reviews.Author: mackieds
Reviews.Content: Very nice hotel in a great location. Rooms are very new, modern, comfortable and have everything you need. Ours was a one bedroom apartment that had a full kitchen and laundry facilities, iphone dock, 2 flat screen tvs, dining table, heated towel racks, etc... and hotel is only steps from a train station. My only beef would be extra charges for internet in your room. Is that really necessary??

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel+”
Reviews.Author: Robza
Reviews.Content: Our stay was excellent. We had a studio appartment, which has a little kitchen (a sink, microwave, fridge, dishwasher and some essentials such plates, etc). Furthermore the room has small sitting area and a comfortable bed. Also the bathroom with a nice warm and powerfull shower). We were there in the winter and the room was always nice and warm (we even opened the window from some fresh air during the day). Only the breakfast was expensive as at most hotels (19 euros), but there is a little coffee shop 100 meters from the hotel which serves excellent sandwiches. The location is also very good. It is in East Berlin and all the sites are in walking distance. If you are not keen on walking the S-bahn station is across the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location”
Reviews.Author: Robert C
Reviews.Content: we stayed here just after xmas.location is great near all public transport,museum island,unter der linden ,alexanderplatz all within walking distance,tour buses ran from just round the corner.apartment was excellent,very clean and well equipped,allthe staff were very pleasant ant very helpful .we definitely stay here again and recommend it

Reviews.Title: “Nice but could be cleaner”
Reviews.Author: erock1974
Reviews.Content: Good location, nice place overall. My one complaint is that the kitchenette was a bit dirty when I arrived. The rest of the room was very clean.

Reviews.Title: “Classy apartments in a great location”
Reviews.Author: pauljamescampbell
Reviews.Content: We stayed here hoping for good-quality, contemporary, well-located accommodation. And that's exactly what we got. The Adina Apartments are located just round the corner from Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station and only 5 mins walk north from the main museum and park area in central Berlin. Around the nearby area is some great places for design hounds and foodies. With an excellent selection of great design shops and restaurants within easy striking distance. Our apartment, and in fact the whole hotel, was furnished to an excellent standard. With high-quality finishings and good contemporary design features. Outside of the US it's probably one of the biggest rooms we've stayed in. Particularly impressive considering the room held a 4-person table, sofa and small kitchenette. The service was also excellent. With very friendly front-desk attendants whom spoke great English, but also didn't mind entertaining people attempting their hand at some German. Due to the location, service and quality I highly recommend this place as a base for exploring Berlin over the weekend. I'll personally be looking out for other Adina branches on future trips.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location and great cocktails”
Reviews.Author: grant K
Reviews.Content: Originally booked for the Adina Hauptbahnhof, when we arrived they had no record of our reservation, and they claimed to be full. Fortunately we had proof of purchase. The staff at the A.Hauptbahnhof could not of been more helpful, booking us in to the the Adina Hackescher, and arranging and paying for our taxi transfer. How lucky were we - the A. Hack. was in a fantastic location. The rooms were very good, maybe a little too hot! We did not eat there, only sleeping and out on to the tourist trails but I definitely recommend this place....and the cocktails were great.

Reviews.Title: “Can't recommend it enough”
Reviews.Author: Ourhols
Reviews.Content: I'm not sure that there is much that I can add to the fantastic reviews that this hotel has already had. It really is a great place to stay. My partner and I arrived at 10:30am (after a very early flight) and were hoping to leave our bags behind reception. However, to our delight we were checked in immediately and allowed in to our room - a real bonus that we weren't expecting. The location is perfect for exploring Berlin and has many, many great restaurants and bars right on the door step. In fact the hotel bar is very nice as well - the cocktails are amazing and on special offer between 17:00 and 19:30! We didn't have breakfast in the hotel, but on the left of the hotel as you come out is a great place for cakes, snacks and hot drinks. The rooms are a fantastic size with a mini kitchen (although we didn't use it - too many great restaurants to go to), lovely bathrooms and very comfortable beds. A top choice for Berlin!

Reviews.Title: “Does what it says on the box”
Reviews.Author: carocha
Reviews.Content: We very much enjoyed the Adina hotel. The hotel rooms are nice enough especially given the price and ideally suited for families. The hotel staff really went out of their way to be helpful in particular the desk manager Aaron really helped us out in finding a baby sitter at short notice. There is a decent gym and generous and tasty breakfast. So all in all a very nice hotel - not a luxury experience - but a very fair and nice place with great value for money. The one gripe was the room service food was pretty gross, however given the location there is no reason for one ever to eat at the hotel with a myriad of great resteraunts across all prices just waiting to be explored. The location really is top notch next to museums, trendy shops and amazing christmas markets, the ideal base to explore an enjoy Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Centrally located, very comfortable hotel”
Reviews.Author: ndes
Reviews.Content: I recommend this hotel for its location, comfortable and clean rooms and friendly staff. The kitchenette had a microwave and well sized fridge. The beds were comfortable but we couldn't get used to single bed sized duvets in a queen sized bed! Some channels on TV were disappointingly not available. Its location is outstanding, with restaurants, nightclubs, a large shopping centre as well as many of the tourist sights being within walking distance. Don't forget to buy a 3 day museum pass, which at 19 euros is one of the great bargains. It covers almost all of the superb museums in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “new, modern, great location”
Reviews.Author: hamilstra
Reviews.Content: We chose this place because it was easy to get to from the station and in an interesting area historically plus we had plans to immerse ourselves in the museums so close by on museum island. The rooms are modern, very new and well equipped.The reception staff were very helpful with our questions. The breakfast was very good and we loved the Happy hour concept in the evenings where we indulged in some excellent cocktails. The only disappointment was that as a party of 4 we would have liked to have been given the 2 bedroom appartment that we had booked (and paid for in full at the same) rather than a studio and 1 bedroom appartment with inter connecting door. It was unclear why we couldn't have it, it was not what we had booked and the layout was less appealing for our purposes. Having said that I would definitely stay here again though ring rather than trust their online website for the booking.Everything else about our stay was faultless.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families and awesome location”
Reviews.Author: Cyndi-Ryan
Reviews.Content: I stayed in the apartment for 2 nights with my husband and 2 children. It was a perfect set-up because we had the conveniences of a kitchen, washer/dryer, dining area and a small balcony. We loved the location, which is right next to the u-bahn and within walking distance to a lively area of restaurants, shops, grocery stores, ice cream... The staff was very professional and friendly- they spoke great English. Free wifi that worked too (although you had to always login with a user id and password which got a little annoying after a while).

Reviews.Title: “Best Location and Apartment”
Reviews.Author: allovertw
Reviews.Content: This place has everything! We are currently staying at this Hotel and it is the best holiday accommodation we have had in a long time. Besides the apartment which has it all including laundry, there is a gym, sauna and spa. The breakfast is moderately expensive but in this case you do get what you pay for, it is excellent. Staff have been great and all too happy to help. Would recommend this to even the fussiest of 5 star travellers. The only thing they could do to improve it is have the WiFi in the room as part of the deal, but It is free in the lobby lounge.

Reviews.Title: “Review 28 30 October 2011”
Reviews.Author: NigelDJohannesburg
Reviews.Content: Great hotel well located, with friendly and efficient staff. Good value for money. Housekeeping was however a bit lacking with room on one occasion only being made up at 1600 hours !! TV/Radio system went offline every night so when one was dressing in the morning there was absolutely no TV available to watch news etc. This happened three nights in a row .

Reviews.Title: “Space, Comfort, Unbeatable Location.”
Reviews.Author: Banjax
Reviews.Content: Spent 6 days here in October in a one-bed apartment, which was on the 7th floor at the corner of the building. Wrap-around balcony with outdoor furniture and good views gave a nice sense of openness. Comfortable bed and pillows. Spacious shower. Great little kitchen. TV with several English channels - BBC1, BBC3, Channel 4, Film4, E4, More4, Nickleodeon, CNN, CNBC, Bloomberg, BBC World News. Good sound-proofing, but even with the windows open at night, the noise from outside was okay because we were up high. Seemed smaller than the advertised 45m, but this was probably due to the extra balcony space, and we still had plenty of room. Pleasant lobby with comfortable seating and free wi-fi. Forgot to bring a swimsuit so can't comment on the jacuzzi in the wellness centre downstairs. Staff helpful and friendly. My husband has a bad back and found the living-area seating too low, so they accommodated him by bringing up one of the outdoor armchairs from the courtyard. They also went to some trouble to map out a public transport route for us to the Brucke Museum. Had a partial power-out one evening and the young man at reception came up, discovered a tripped switch in the fuse box and restored power straight away. The hotel's restaurant isn't half-bad either - comfortable, laid-back, slightly funky atmosphere. They do an appetizing Aussie burger for around €10. Location unbeatable. Cafes, restaurants, boutiques, speciality shops everywhere. Well-stocked supermarket (closed Sundays) a 2-minute walk away, and a very nice bakery/coffee shop (open 7 days) on the corner. Hackescher Hof Cinema (200m away) shows original version films only, and there are always one or two English-language ones on the programme if, like me, you don't speak German. Public transport links on the doorstep. S-bahn and tram lines are 100m away, and the No. 100 bus, which is a great route that runs along the east-west axis of the city and stops at a lot of the major sights, is 100m in the other direction. All in all, this came very close to being that elusive animal, the perfect package. Next time I plan a trip to Berlin, I won't bother looking elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “The best apartment hotel I've stayed at”
Reviews.Author: Zilpah5
Reviews.Content: This is an excellent hotel. The room was great with modern design furniture and a well equipped kitchenette. The location was central and the staff very helpful. I will definitely stay at this and other Adina hotels again.

Reviews.Title: “Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hackescher Markt”
Reviews.Author: anozjc
Reviews.Content: Absolutely brilliant hotel. Great service, terrific rooms and spacious. New and very quirky decor. Strong Australian influence. We felt right at home here, and it has the facilities that you expect in a business class hotel. Staff are very friendly and helpful. After a number of days travelling, it was wonderful to have access in our suite to a washer and dryer. Highly recommend this hotel - you won't go wrong with this one.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: Rumpole1
Reviews.Content: Adina is well situated near both the S Ban and the main tourist atractions..Being a hotel apartment it is ideal for the traveller who wants a home away from home.Australian owned it has a certain comfort level that travellers will appreciate,Staff are frendly, the rooms clean and spacious with seperate bedroom.The washer and dryer are a welcome addition to travellers who are on the road for some time The only downside in room 212 was the flushing of the toilet which needed some attention othewise all was great. The hotel has been opened less than 12 months.Would we stay there again YES and would we recommend it to others YES. .

Reviews.Title: “Transferred form Adina Hauptbahnhof”
Reviews.Author: Verbiest
Reviews.Content: I booked my business trip to Berlin through the website of the hotel. I made my booking in june for hotel Adina Hauptbahnhof wich was confirmed to me by e-mail. Just 2 days prior to my arrival I recieved an e-mail telling me they had made a "mistake" and I was transferred to Adina Hackescher markt instead. This was particulary unpleasant for me as my collegue had a booking as well in Adina Hauptbahnhof. I tried to contact the hotel asking to keep my original booking but there was no possibility doing so. Fortunately my collegue could change her booking as wel so we ended both up at Hackescher Markt. The hotel looks fresh and new. The staff was friendly at all times, the room spatious and clean. A warning if you don't like hard matrasses: the bed is one of the hardest I ever slept in...! I recieved complimentary breakfast for the inconvenience of the transfer but not my collegue wich I found somewhat unpleasant. The environment is ok with loads of shops and restaurants in the neigbourhood wich is fine. I definatelly would find this one of the best city hotels I ever stayed in, but I was dissapointed by the very late transfer I had to make.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location. Modern furnishings.”
Reviews.Author: Keena_b
Reviews.Content: We booked a one bedroom appartment. Found it spacious and modern with all the amenities. Breakfast is expensive - buffet only. There's a good bakery around the corner. The train station is 2 minutes away. 5 minute walk to museum island. The staff is helpful and knowledgeable. We will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “great location, great room”
Reviews.Author: Efrat1
Reviews.Content: We had a great experience at Adina Hotel. It was so near by the Hackescher Markt and the S-bann and yet the hotel was in a quiet alley and the room was quiet too (on the 7th floor). The room was well equiped with a perfect kitchenette. All was new and clean. Staff was friendly and helpful. We already started recommending Adina to all our friends and we're looking forward for our next visit to Berlin and Adina. Thank you.

Reviews.Title: “Great way to stay”
Reviews.Author: FlorafromHawaii
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our week in Berlin even more because of the convenience and comfort of the Adina. Staff was great, facilities well kept and serviced. We want to return.

Reviews.Title: “yes, we'll go back”
Reviews.Author: thomasO
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. I chose it because of its location, the fact that it is new, very close to public transportation, and non-smoking. And yes, the location was wonderful. We enjoyed the many shops and restaurants (especially Oxymoron, see review) in the Hackescher Markt courtyards, and the S-bahn immediately around the corner. I chose a one bedroom apartment for 2 of us. We had a kitchenette, a table for our tourist books and maps, and eating, a couch to sit, a small desk, a balcony, a bedroom with sliding doors to cubby-hole storage, and large bath with washer and dryer. The staff was helpful and informative when we asked questions. We had cocktails in the bar, sat outside and enjoyed the weather. We did not use the plunge pool. We used the washer and dryer. My suggestions are-modify the design of the sliding doors to the cubby-hole shelf storage. I got tired of banging the doors to and fro. And help! Please provide a coffee making devise for those of us who drink coffee. I understand the hotel is Australian-perhaps tea drinking. But I needed my brewed coffee! We hope to go back soon.

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel in the best location”
Reviews.Author: Rebekka82
Reviews.Content: This brand new hotel is definitely worth every penny. The hotel is nice, large, clean and bright rooms. But it is really the location that took my breath away. It is located right next to a train station but there is no noise from it, right next to the station there is a buzzing square with loads of cafes, bars and restaurant and even a club that is open 24/7. But again, we never heard any noise coming from the square. We stayed for a week and absolutely fell in love with the city, but I would definitely stay here the next time I come to visit.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Brilliant”
Reviews.Author: MGABZ
Reviews.Content: Having stayed at their sister hotel in Checkpoint Charlie last year, I was expecting the same brilliant service as I had received previously, and I have to say they didn't disappoint. The hotel is located in the bustling Hackescher Markt area filled with many resteraunts, cafes, bars and boutiques all open from early morning till late at night. It is literally a five minute walk from the Marienkirche TXL Busstop, if arriving from Tegel (€2.30 One Way) which is only a 30 minute travel. Hackescher Markt S Bahn station is just behind the hotel and affords travel across Berlin. One piece of advice would be to purchase a Berlin Welcome Card from the hotel reception, which allows unlimited travel on the rail, underground, tram and bus network as well as discount off of entry in to attactions. On arrival at the hotel we received a warm greeting from the polite receptionist and despite arriving early at 11am, we were given the keycards to our room. The studio apartment itself was excellent. Modern and clean, it had a well equipped kitchenette with dishwasher, microwave and cooker hob. The TV had several English channels available. The bathroom again was very modern, with the only downside being no bath only a shower. Most of the staff members were happy to assist with directions or assistance. The hotel has an excellent spa on the lower ground floor with two large spa tubs and a sauna as well as a small but functional fitness room. A great way to unwind after a days sightseeing. During our entire stay we seemed to have the place to ourselves. Again the hotel does have it's own restaurant "Alto" which was reasonable value and provides an excellent hamburger, there are plenty of eateries located in the arches under the s-Bahn station which even provide live music at nights. Overall if staying in Berlin, you can't get any better a place to stay than the Adina Apartments. They are quite simply perfect. I just wish they had more hotels in different European cities.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartment, awesome location, great staff”
Reviews.Author: Kris G
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for a week during August as she had a Yoga thing going on (very detailed I know) and I tagged along for the express reason to chill, relax and check out a bit of Berlin. The hotel itself is excellently situated, you guessed it, right by the Hackescher Markt in Berlin, itself right by the center. Even better (for me at least) was its proximity to the Museum Island (literally about 15 min walk out the front door) and of course, Unter den Linden. From here, you can pretty much see all the culture you could possibly take. Back to the apartment, we had a large living area, seperate bedroom, large bathroom (with bathtub) and also, the shower had very nice pressure. Love a good shower. Moving along, the cooking facilities where good, there is a dishwasher as well, very handy. The rest of the furnishings were comfy and the TWO(!) TVs, well, they worked (one in the living room, one in the bedroom). The staff, super friendly and helpful and they also have (not cheap) parking as well. Great stay, really enjoyed it and if we are back in Berlin, we'll be staying there.

Reviews.Title: “Brand New, Super Value, Excellent Location.”
Reviews.Author: MFM14
Reviews.Content: We checked in late and were so ever pleasantly surprised at the quality of hotel and room. The staff went the extra mile to help us with tips of where to eat and play. We found the room to be very spacious and provided for out every need. This… will be the only place we stay upon our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Greatest location, beautiful place, we will defiantly go back”
Reviews.Author: ronit_dolev
Reviews.Content: Adina's apt. Hotel is centrally located, beautifully designed' with the worm and personal service it is a perfect place to stay in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great location, lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: JanieAlison
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 7 nights and really enjoyed it. The room itself was spacious and well-furnished in a contemporary style and the kitchenette was very well-equipped (apart from the absence of a coffee pot/machine!). Good access to Wifi - the charge for 24 hours is for 24 hours used in total and is good value. The room was cleaned every day. There is a really nice wellness suite with gym, sauna and jacuzzis. The location of the hotel is superb, being a very short distance from the museums and galleries, and the central areas of Berlin, while Hackescher Market itself has a variety of cafes, restaurants, and interesting shops, as well as a weekly market. I would highly recommend this hotel as it was good value and yet felt luxurious and the location is great.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations.”
Reviews.Author: rupsfrazer
Reviews.Content: LOVED the location and the apartment hotel was just what we wanted - independence to cater for ourselves as and when, plus all the boring chores being discreetly taken care of while we were out. Excellent value for money.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, great staff, would recommend”
Reviews.Author: RichardDTS
Reviews.Content: This was the first time we had stayed at this hotel and the staff were excellent, Alexander on the front desk and Jan in the Bar/restaurant . Nothing was too much trouble at all. They helped with sightseeing options, dinner options and general information. We also ate in the restaurant and while the menu is limited the quality and delvery was very good. The burger meal is huge and great vlaue, steak excellent and the chicken strips really unusual. The hotel is located within a 5 minute walk to Hackesher Markt Station and easy to the S or U Bahn anywhere. Keep up the great work and will stay again.

Reviews.Title: “Only good things to say”
Reviews.Author: Antwerp2Dutch
Reviews.Content: This was an excellent hotel on all counts as far as we were concerned: a great combination of brand new room, stylish design, roomy, clean, great location, and helpful staff. It's great value, but nevertheless it doesn't feel cheap at all, but rather classy actually. We had relatives staying at the Westin Grand at the same time, and clearly our studio room in Adina was much better in comparison. The fact that it was a studio room meant the bedroom was connected to the other areas, but still it was very spacious, the kitchen was fully equipped and there was a large wall closet that could fit a lot. The wi-fi connection was extra but the cost was negligible. We skipped breakfast in the hotel and had great pastries in the Kamps bakery on the corner of the same block. In short, this hotel is highly recommended and we definitely plan to be back next time we're in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “OMG, amazing”
Reviews.Author: aidomelb
Reviews.Content: had the most fantastic 1 Bedroom apartment on the 7th floor, wrap round balcony, loads of space, great view and the staff are so hospitable. The decor is beautiful and everything so clean and new. The location is the best. Walk to Museum Island, the markt, the Berlin tower, and lots of restaurants and bars within a 3 minute stroll. Will definitely be back! Well done Adina/Medina!!

Reviews.Title: “City living at its best! 100% Perfect”
Reviews.Author: Shiraz64
Reviews.Content: My husband and I went here for my birthday for 3 nights. We arrived early at 10.30 am and were given access to the room straightaway. The staff were great and very helpful. The day we arrived was heavy rain and lowish temperatures, so the rooms were heated accordingly. As I dont like hot rooms I asked if our air con could be adjusted so we could control it individually and it was done immediately. The apartment has a small balcony and we had room 511, which had a view over the railway and a view of the TV Tower. There was no outside noise at anytime of day. The Kitchenette is furnished with all items you need to cook and eat with. The bedroom comfortable with ample storage and an iron and ironing board in the wardrobe. The living area was spacious. The whole place was spotless. There is a bakery and organic food shop just on the corner. Also Brau Haus Lempke which is worth a visit if you like local beer. The station is also minutes away. We will definitely stay here again or at any of the sister hotels. Go there you wont be disappointed!

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, relaxing stay”
Reviews.Author: margory
Reviews.Content: We had stayed in Adina in other cities during our previous visits and loved it, and this one was no exception. The hotel is brand new, so everything is sparkling clean. Facilities are excellent, rooms are spacious and cozy ( we had an one apartment room), furnishings are nice and comfortable. The Apartment-hotel is very convenient for a family since the small kitchen with all appliances enabling us to prepare some fast meals, satisfying the kids’ requirements. It is also convenient to have a washer/dryer in the room. Staff is very friendly and helpful. The location is superb, as Hackescher Markt S-Bahn station was across the street, and tram and bus stops were located a few steps further, making it very easy to get around town, although we did a fair share of walking along with the kids as main sights were nearby ( museum island, Fernsehturm, the red townhall, even Unter den Linten was within walking limits). Although we did our shopping at Ku’damm, we realized afterwards, that Friedrichstrasse ( again not far from the Hotel), as well as shopping malls at Alexanderplatz would be another great options for shopping lovers. Gym and spa area were also very clean and relaxing after a long day sighseeing/ walking. As we didn’t use the restaurant, we can’t comment on that ( breakfast was rather pricey, so we opted for a non-inclusive breakfast stay). There were so many restaurants in the area, within walking distance, so finding a place for breakfast/ dinner was not an issue during our 5 nights stay. Wi-fi connection in the rooms was at a cost ( EUR 14 per 24 hours, quite pricey I could say). The time for the cleaning of the rooms was a thing that bothered us, since this took place on two at least two occasions, during our siesta, and we had to tell them that we didn't need the room cleaned. Overall we are very pleased with our stay. The hotel was located ideally, in a quiet area, although in a central area and is highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel all round”
Reviews.Author: Popey2011
Reviews.Content: We stayed at adina apartment hauptbahnhof for 3 nights and decided to extend our stay but wanted to be closer to restaurants, pubs and city centre so we moved to this one for 2 nights. Both adinas are modern, spacious, and have great locations. We were in 15 hotels over 4 weeks in Europe all 4-5 star and this was the best by far for value, space, location an comfort. Also modern fitness facilities and helpful staff

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: talblet
Reviews.Content: My two friends and I picked this for a girls weekend away in Berlin and were absolutely thrilled. The lobby is bright and welcoming and full of quirky pieces of colorful furniture. The staff were very friendly and efficient and all spoke perfect English which is such a huge help! The rooms were large, well-appointed and cleverly designed to make the best use of the space. The kitchen facilities were of a high standard and more than adequate for preparing basic meals with an electric hob, microwave and plenty of pans and utensils. The bathroom was large and spotless with a wonderfully powerful shower and the beds were some of the most comfortable I have ever slept in. Our only very minor complaint was that we couldn't access the paid for movie channels and there was only BBC 1 available in English. The weather was absolutely foul the whole time we were there and it would have been nice to be able to sit and watch a film on one of the evenings instead of braving the rain again! All in all a great stay and I wouldn't hesitate to recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Fresh and fruity”
Reviews.Author: orangeAmsterdam
Reviews.Content: Located near one of Berlin's hot spots (Hackescher Markt and Hackesche Höfe) and on walking distance from the shores of the river Spree with great views on the Berlin Dome is this place that offers excellent value for money. The interior is 'funky minimalism' or fresh and fruity, young design, helpful and efficient staff, good rooms with kitchen facilites. No need to cook though with all the bars, terraces and (night) restaurants. Bike rental service. An original place if you feel you have seen the all th big hotel chains. The atmosphere of the hotel somehow matches the Berlin vibes; non conformistic, relaxed and yet up to standard.

Reviews.Title: “Very Good Hotel”
Reviews.Author: From_South
Reviews.Content: Stayed at room # 812 (1 Bedroom Apartment - King or Twin Beds, Separate bedroom with king or twin bedding). Very clean and quiet. Close (5 min walking distance) to Alexanderplatz. Same distance to the Museum Island. Very spacious room, dinning and kitchen area, small balcony(top floor room), nice large bathroom and separated bedroom. Certainly would come back.

Reviews.Title: “Lightsleepers go there !”
Reviews.Author: turysta78
Reviews.Content: We spent five days in Adina at Hackescher Markt this July. We had two neighboring rooms. The hotel is very good in probably all aspects: The rooms are nice and spacious, with regular size table, small additional sofa, cooking facilities, regular fridge and micro wave. There are no connecting rooms, but this is probably because the hotel offers also regular flats (with 2-3 bedrooms I think). The bathroom also spacious. The service is responsive and attending. The decor is modern and simple, with australian references. For those who prefer hotels with the shine of marble and gold, it may be a disappointment, but we found it nice. The overall atmosphere is informal and casual. Pets allowed (I am unsure on what conditions, but saw several dogs). I also saw people taking their bikes to the rooms, which I found abit surprising at the first glance, but I guess this is fine. The hotel is very clean and well kept. I would recommend the hotel to the lightsleepers - I probably never before had a hotel room that was so silent. The aircon device working almost soundless, the door almost soundproof, the windows - although big and openable (good choice for the fresh air) - virtually allowing no sound from the outside. For those who prefer silence to the street view, I suggest you book the room facing the backyard (with the view of the office building there). The hotel has about 40% of such rooms, so there should be no problem with this choice if you tell them in advance. The room price is very reasonable, although breakfast not included. Breakfast in the hotel is costly (and served in rather limited restaurant/bar area, which makes the thing a bit disorganized when crowded), but there are at least four places within 150m from the hotel offering very good breakfasts for less than half of the hotel breakfast price. The uderground garage charge is also a bit expensive, but this is the only option to park your car in this part of the city. The location is excellent and I will not repeat the other reviews. Excellent mojito at the hotel bar. I will go back when again in Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Very good”
Reviews.Author: Paivia
Reviews.Content: Very good location with easy access to public transportation. Clean, quiet, nice rooms. At least in our room there was a washing machine and a dryer which is a bonus if you're staying longer. We didn't have breakfast at the hotel, the first morning we had a great brunch in Cafe Morgenland (booked a table in advance) and the second morning we had not-so-good coffee in the bakery in the same building with the hotel. We will definately choose this hotel next time we're visiting Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location, Lovely Design, Good Food”
Reviews.Author: BellaMazor
Reviews.Content: We traveled with 2 young kids and 2 family members, We rented a 2-bedrooms apartment connecting a studio, stayed for 5 nights and had a wonderful time at Adina. Every request was answered, we used the room service and the food was delicious. Certainly will return on our next trip to Berlin.

Reviews.Title: “Best way to move to a new city - and perfect location as a tourist!”
Reviews.Author: Pamanda
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for two weeks at the end of March when I moved to Berlin. My company was paying my first two weeks and this was a great choice, since it's the perfect location, convenient to everything in Berlin (and next to a main SBahn station with access to at least 3-4 tram lines, and steps away from Alexanderplatz) and there is a mini kitchenette in the room so I didn't have to eat out every meal. The bathroom is clean and has a large shower and a heated towel rack, and there is plenty of closet space. Plus the staff is always very friendly and helpful. I was really very happy with my stay here and would definitely recommend it to anyone visiting Berlin. Also, since I was staying for a two week period, I was able to negotiate the price a bit to get internet included, (good to keep in mind they are reasonable for longer stays!) I really loved this hotel with all its modern comforts.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodation & location, would definitely recommend”
Reviews.Author: MJHP
Reviews.Content: The Adina has all the benefits of a hotel but with the flexibility of apartment style accommodation. We had a one bedroom apartment that was very spacious, with an open plan lounge, dinning and kitchen area, separate bedroom and large bathroom. Very modern interior with two flat screen TV's one in the lounge and one in the bedroom. The location is perfect, train stop just round the corner, lovely square near by with lots of bars and restaurants. Five minutes from Alexanderplatz and the museumsinsel (museum island). We stayed here on a four day break and it was perfect, would definitely return and recommend it.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location - Nice Rooms”
Reviews.Author: wideworld_7
Reviews.Content: We had booked a grea topening special deal (99 Euros) on Travelzoo for five nights, which included breakfast. Unfortunately our flight was delayed that we missed our first night entirely and our suitcases were also lost. The staff was very accomodating and upgraded us to a room with a balcony because they felt sorry for us. The next night, our suitcases were waiting for us in our room. The room was new and very clean. The shower was probably the nicest shower I have ever experienced at a hotel. However, the hot tub and sauna were only luke warm, not enought to really warm up after a day of walking through the drizzle. We thought that the breakfast was very nice. The staff always kept inquiring of how they could cook our eggs for us. A la carte, the breakfast is 19 Euros, and that I believe is overpriced. There are several places within a block or two where you can get a decent breakfast much cheaper. The location cannot be beat, right next to the Museum Island and next to the train station. Booking this hotel was one of the things that we did right on this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Comfortable room, very convenient location”
Reviews.Author: Gat16
Reviews.Content: Our apartment at Adina Hackescher Markt was very modern and reasonably spacious, and we were very comfortable during our stay. Our apartment faced an internal courtyard and was very quiet. Our rate didn’t include breakfast but we were happy to eat this in the room as it had basic kitchen facilities. Internet is available and it worked well, although there was a small charge (we paid €3.50 for 180 minutes on a hop-on/hop off basis). The staff were helpful when we had queries. As others have noted, the location is really convenient. There is a range of eating/drinking places in the immediate vicinity, the train is very close and Museum Island and Alexanderplatz are both just a few minutes walk.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be going back...”
Reviews.Author: Tony187514
Reviews.Content: First of all, we originally booked at the "Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hauptbahnhof" for the good price and its high rank on the TripAdvisor list. The we saw the sister hotel "Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hackescher Markt" that was recently open, had even more convenient prices and had also very good comments on Trip Advisor, so we changed our reservation. All the reasons why we didn't like it: - At arrival we saw that the black furniture of the kitchen as full of greasy fingerprints. - The second evening of our stay we came back just to know that there was no hot water on the hotel because of public works (subway, I understood) on the zone. The service should be restored on the "evening". By 9:00 P.M., the second time I called the reception to ask when would we be getting hot water (we don't know, was the answer) I suggested that we should get a discount for we were paying for a service that was not being fully provided. If they had a slight idea of what customer satisfaction is, they could have offered us a free dinner or free breakfast and we would not have felt so aggravated. But the answer was "It's not the hotels problem, it's fault of the government of Berlin". - Once we cambe back and found the dishwasher working. When it finished, I opened it to find that the dishes were dirty because they didn't out the soap tablet on the dishwasher. - The waste baskets were not emptied every day. - Internet service (wired) is EXPENSIVE (€14.50 for 24 hours) and it is terrible. We connected our laptop one evening and signed up for a 24 hour period. The next morning, we found that we had to sign up AGAIN for 24 hours! We must say that we spoke with the receptionist and cancelled one of the charges from our account. This happened three or four times during our stay. One evening we had to sign up three times because the service kept on being interrupted. It was another service that we paid for and that was correctly provided. - Bed covers: for some reason beyond my comprehension, on a double bed they use two single bed covers. Very uncomfortable. - Cleaning: the day we arrived we saw a moth of dust besides the bed. It stayed there during our stay and probably it's still there. Three evenings during our one week stay we came back to the hotel to find that the room hasn't been cleaned yet. One day we had to ask to the reception and they simply told us that the person in charge had too much work and that she FORGOT to clean our room. - While moving the cushions of the sofa I found bread crumbs, candy wraps and lots of hair below. Yuck! In all, after reading other comments on Trip Advisor we expected much more from the "Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hackescher Markt" and we feel terribily dissapointed. We would never return and certainly I wouldn't recommend it to my friends or family. Or to anyone I know.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic apartment hotel in a great location!”
Reviews.Author: KittenMittens
Reviews.Content: I enjoyed my stay at the Adina Apartment Hotel Hackescher Markt very much. It is only a 5 minute walk from Alexanderplatz train station and 5 minute walk from Museum Island were many of Berlins top musuems such as the Pergamon and the Neues. There are also lots of cafes and restaurants in the Hackescher Markt area. I stayed in a studio room and this was ideal for my needs. The room was bright and spacious, with big windows which let in a lot of sunlight. The kitchenette was to the left of the room door, and consisted of a fridge, microwave, dishwasher, kettle and cupboards containing glasses and crockery. Although I ate out most nights, I did find the fridge very useful for storing drinks and small snacks. The bed was big and comfortable with 2 single sized feather down duvets which were nice and warm. There were 2 pillows provided, however these were not quite to my personal preference as 1 was too firm and the other too soft. In the welcome book it does say that they have a pillow menu, so I could have asked for a different type if I had so wished. The bed linen was not changed during my 5 night stay, and while this did not bother me or my boyfriend as we don't change hte bed at home everynight, it could bother other people. However, it is stated that a daily linen change can be arranged if guests ask for it. The dining/sitting area was quite a reasonable size and consisted of a dining table with 2 chairs, coffee table, foot stool, TV area with ipod docking station and a small but comfortable couch. One of the reason why I decided to stay at this particular hotel, apart from price and location, was the fact that there was a seperate sitting area where I could relax after a day exploring rather than having to sit on the bed. The bathroom was very nice and spacious with good lighting. It had nice granite coloured tiles which gave it a very modern look. The shower itself was quite big compared to other hotels I have stayed in, with a big shower head. The glass door only covered half the shower, I never had any issues though with water splashing on the bathroom floor. I am very pleased that I stayed here. The hotel was in a great location, it was an ideal base for exploring Berlin but it was also in quite a quiet area - although this could change come summertime! The staff were very friendly and helpful and the room was very comfortable. I would definately consider staying here again if I return to Berlin. The only real issue I had was that the rooms seemed to get cleaned quite late, there was one occassion when a cleaner came to clean our room at about 3.45pm and we told them we didn't need it cleaned as we had just got in after hours of walking and sightseeing and didn't want to go back out again! So maybe the management should think about hiring more cleaning staff.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: SeptemberSeven
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located between the Museumsinsel and Hackesche Maerkte. Both are just a three minute walk away. A metro station is nearby too. The location is perfect to explore Berlin. The hotel is quite new so rooms are still in good condition. Rooms are clean, rather spacious and comfortable. I had a room facing the backyard so it was quiet at night. The spa is ok but nothing special. Photos on the hotel website are misleading, there is no swimming pool. The negative bit of this hotel is the breakfast. Service there is a disaster and staff appear to be quite unorganized. It is better to have breakfast at one of the many cafes nearby.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Apartment Hotel”
Reviews.Author: kcnz
Reviews.Content: I have stayed in a sister property a couple of months ago at Checkpoint Charlie and thought I would try this hotel for a change for a long weekend (escaping the Royal Wedding). We arrived at about 3pm and had booked a 2 bed room apartment. It was not ready on arrival which was slightly irritating and after about 10 minutes it was clear it was not going to be ready that quickly. Staff were very polite and apologetic and quickly sorted out compensation without being asked and we were happy. We left our bags and went out for a couple of hours and came back. The apartment was great: it was clean and spacious. Everything worked, the staff were always polite and helpful. We had no problem with street noise. The views are urban and I can't see it matters which street you face. We had breakfast one morning which was fine but as others have noted there is on shortage of local eateries offering breakfast. A great hotel in a lovely city. I would certainly return.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent place to stay - avoid breakfast”
Reviews.Author: Hampshire123
Reviews.Content: We really did enjoy our stay here. It is so well located - 10 minutes from museum island and not far from the Brandenburg Gate and beyond. Apartment concept very good - lots more space and a table to sit at. Hakescher Markt S Bahn is just few minutes walk. Tickets are from a machine which has a version in English and other languages - there are zones for pricing and most places are within Berlin AB. But much is within walking distance of the Adina. The only thing we didn't get on with was breakfast. All the Adina staff are really good and try to be helpful but couldn't really achieve this at breakfast. There is not enough space and so many guests end up eventually being seated at little round tables in the bar, with perhaps enough space for 2 - just - but certainly not for 3, which we were. There is a bakers just round the corner that does several different breakfasts - or rolls and croissants with coffee at about 2/3 the price. We'd recommend going room only and going to the bakers - turn left out of the hotel and its just at the end of the block. It might not be open Sundays - perhaps someone else will report back. All in all a good stay in a fascinating City.

Reviews.Title: “Great location. Fabulous staff.”
Reviews.Author: rlewisk
Reviews.Content: Wonderful location. Near cafes/market and within walking distance to many Berlin attractions. Right near a subway and tram stop. Comfortable rooms, immaculately clean with modern touches. Cool lobby and restaurant/bar downstairs. The best part of this great hotel was the amazing staff. The front desk staff were all so helpful in answering our questions about how to get around Berlin and what was best to see. They helped make our trip a wonderful experience. We highly recommend this newly opened Adina hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Clean and in a great location.”
Reviews.Author: MarnieNJ
Reviews.Content: Berlin is an amazing city and this is a great place to see it from. The location is phenomenal - the metro is a block away - the neighborhood is hopping. Lots of good restaurants and walking distance to the museums and the Brandenburg gate. The hotel was really clean and modern and it was great to have so much space. The included breakfast was good but very crowded and a little understaffed. The Internet was pay for a block of time - a bit cheap of them considering the cost of the suite. Overall a good value though.

HotelInfo.Name: Adina Apartment Hotel Berlin Hackescher Markt
